{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandible, or lower jaw, is moved by several muscles. The temporalis and masseter muscles are primarily responsible for elevating the mandible, or closing the mouth. The medial pterygoid also assists in elevating the mandible but also contributes to side-to-side grinding movements. The lateral pterygoid, on the other hand, is unique in that it helps to depress the mandible, or open the mouth.", "answer_choice": "C. Lateral pterygoid"}
